alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 6:01AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN PINE AND SOUTHWESTERN BURNETT COUNTIES THROUGH 630 AM CDT... At 601 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Pierz, to Bock, to 6 miles east of Cambridge, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pine City, Rock Creek, Henriette, Randall, Greely, West Rock, Trade River, and Chengwatana State Forest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
